channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Crowds Watch Israeli Airstrikes from a Beirut Hillside
item.description: Every night, dozens gather at the hillside to watch airstrikes rain down on the city’s southern suburbs. The ritual offers a window into the war — and...

item.title: ‘Busiest Thanksgiving ever’ as 80 million expected to travel for the holiday and record numbers set to flood U.S. airports
item.description: Airline passengers might get lucky like they did last year, when relatively few flights were canceled during the holiday week.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Mount New Attacks Amid Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: Rockets flew on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border even as diplomats tried to finalize a truce.

item.title: Alex Jones is heading back to court to try to stop The Onion’s purchase of Infowars, calling sale fraud and collusion
item.description: At stake is whether Jones gets to stay at Infowars’ studio in Austin, Texas, under a new owner friendly to him, or whether he gets kicked out by The O...

item.title: Storm Bert Batters UK With Rain and Fierce Winds, Killing at Least 3
item.description: Torrential rain doused most of the country, stymying travel and leading to widespread flooding, landslides, fallen trees and power outages.

item.title: Chinese hackers are mobilizing, U.S. official says
item.description: They could manipulate HVAC systems in server rooms or disrupt power and water to data centers.

item.title: The Trump Transition’s Secret Funding, and a Campus Crackdown
item.description: Plus, payouts for finding pandemic fraud.

item.title: Trump’s Judicial Hero Would Have Hated His Recess Appointments Plan
item.description: Justice Antonin Scalia, a conservative giant, said attempts to circumvent the Senate’s responsibility to vet nominees were “ignoble” and “just made up...

item.title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes Into Homes
item.description: Thick smoke rose from a residential area near an airport in Vilnius, Lithuania, after the plane crashed.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Mount New Attacks Amid Cease-Fire Talks
item.description: Rockets flew on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border even as diplomats tried to finalize a truce.

item.title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes Near Airport in Lithuania, Killing 1
item.description: The crash near Vilnius Airport sparked a fire in a residential area, officials said. One person on board was killed and three others were hospitalized...

item.title: Bosch, one of Germany’s biggest employers, cuts working hours for 10,000 extra staff following expanded layoffs
item.description: Robert Bosch, which employes arounf 429,000 people, is overhauling its workforce as the company struggles with Germany's flatlining economy.

item.title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes Near Airport in Lithuania, Killing 1
item.description: The crash near Vilnius Airport sparked a fire in a residential area, officials said. One person on board was killed and three others were hospitalized...

item.title: Remote work jobs are disappearing—but they’re becoming a talent gold mine for employers still offering them
item.description: The share of remote positions on LinkedIn have plummeted in the last year, but applications for remote jobs are staying strong.

item.title: Crowds Watch Israeli Airstrikes from a Beirut Hillside
item.description: Every night, dozens gather at the hillside to watch airstrikes rain down on the city’s southern suburbs. The ritual offers a window into the war — and...
